sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using inverse matrices
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using inverse matrices:

3x + 4y = 20

7x - 2y = 10

What is the value of x and y in this system of equations?
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using inverse matrices, we first write the given system in matrix form AX = B, where A is the matrix of coefficients, X is the column matrix of variables (x and y), and B is the column matrix of constants.

A = | 3  4 |, X = | x |, B = | 20 |
    | 7 -2 |      | y |      | 10 |

Now, we find the inverse of matrix A, denoted as A^(-1). To do this, we first find the determinant of A:

det(A) = (3 * -2) - (4 * 7) = -6 - 28 = -34

Since the determinant is non-zero, the inverse of A exists. Now, we find A^(-1) using the formula:

A^(-1) = (1/det(A)) * adj(A)

where adj(A) is the adjugate of A, which is the transpose of the cofactor matrix of A. The cofactor matrix of A is:

Cofactor(A) = | -2 -4 |
                         | -7  3 |

Now, we find the transpose of the cofactor matrix:

adj(A) = | -2  -7 |
              | -4   3 |

Now, we can find A^(-1):

A^(-1) = (1/-34) * | -2  -7 |
                             | -4   3 |

A^(-1) = | 1/17   7/34 |
              | 2/17  -3/34 |

Now, we can find the solution X by multiplying A^(-1) with B:

X = A^(-1) * B

X = |  1/17   7/34 | * | 20 |
       |  2/17  -3/34 |    | 10 |

X = | (1/17 * 20) + (7/34 * 10) |
       | (2/17 * 20) + (-3/34 * 10) |

X = | 20/17 + 35/17 |
       | 40/17 - 15/17 |

X = | 55/17 |
       | 25/17 |

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is x = 55/17 and y = 25/17.
